comments:
I have a visual class that I started working on in 3.01 after upgrading to 3.1
and the official 1.1 I did have it working.  I added a menu to the application.
 Even though VE does not support SWT menus the editor seemed to be happy to
ignore it.  At some point I made a change that caused VE to fail with a
NullPointerException.  Below are the log entries:

Created an attachment (id=25997)
A Java project with a visial class that is causing the problem

As requested in the news group (see
http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=4274&group=eclipse.tools.ve#4274)
I have created a defect and attached the visual class.	Actually I attached a
full project.  I stripped out all my personal common libraries and butchered
the code so it compiles cleanly.  The VE problem is still there even though the
application will not run any more.

Joe,
This is the same stack trace as was generated in bug 106404 and could be a dup
of it as well. Please have a look. Thx... Peter

I've already been looking at this.

There are actually two problems here. The first main problem is that we don't
handle SWT Menu's. What happens in parsing is that it sees new Menu(shell,
style); and thinks it is a Control in the "controls" feature of the Shell (i.e.
just another control). But then when it tries to add it to "controls" feature it
fails because it is not a Control. And an EMF bug 106702 causes the next real
control to actually be duplicated in the list.

The second one is with he setupControl and that has something to do with things
being in a bad state from the first failure. We could try to see if the
setupControl is a failure state we should check for, or if it is something that
shouldn't happen if parsing was correct then it may be ignored.

My view is we should fix the Menu problem first and then see what happens next.
We need Gili or Sri to fix the Menu problem.

I just released some initial code to HEAD for some of the problems with Menus.
We still have more problems to fix.

VE will now parse/model Menus/MenuItems, though it has no tooling for it (e.g.,
menus are not on the palette)

The attached CardVersionFixerApp class, will not model the menus as is, because
the init method of Shell is createShell(), since this is the method shell is
created....
The menu is created in createMainMenu(),  the problem is that this method also
has the following expression:
   myShell.setMenuBar (menuBar);

The shell's menuBar setting is done in the createMainMenu... not in createShell().
VE will not pay attention to it... and since the menus are created with no one
(that VE parsed) reference them, it will not model them.

The solution, is to make the menuBar an instance variable, and move the 
myShell.setMenuBar (menuBar);
to the createShell() method, after the call to createMainMenu.

In regards to the createFileMenu(Menu parent) method, VE does not know, at this
time to parse methods with a parent based argument.

Rich, I am moving this defect to you. The only thing that is missing, is a
refresh of EditParts when we snippet add menus.

Created an attachment (id=26172)
MyShell.java

Use this simple sample file as a reference for using menus

All of my code has been released to HEAD.

Gili, the only problem I see left is when you delete a submenu it leaves one
setting behind.

Catch up to all of the code, and use your example from the attachment to this
bug (the MyShell.java), then from the tree select "fileMenuItem" and hit delete.

(In reply to comment #6)
> Created an attachment (id=26172) [edit]
> MyShell.java
> 
> Use this simple sample file as a reference for using menus

Thanks for the work around VE is happy again.

verified with M20050824 that both testcases no longer throw errors and MyShell
actually has a menus working.
*** Bug 108619 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
